title: Video: Westbrook roasts reporter over KD question
text:
All-Star Game: Russell Westbrook roasts reporter over Kevin Durant question February 21, 2017 10:05am by Cameron DaSilva Source: FOX SPORTS THE NBA All-Star Game gave fans everywhere exactly what they were waiting months to see: A connection between Kevin Durant and Russell Westbrook. 
The two hooked up for a smooth alley-oop in the first quarter, bringing back memories of their time together in Oklahoma City. 
The internet was sent into a frenzy, as was the Western Conference bench, but Westbrook didn’t make much of it. He had a painfully awkward exchange with a reporter after the game when asked about the first-quarter connection. 
“Oh, that was a question? … He threw a lob and that’s all that happened. He just threw a lob. It’s basketball. That’s it,” Westbrook responded to the reporter asking for further explanation of the much talked about game highlight. Russell Westbrook at the 2017 NBA All-Star Game. Source: AFP 
The reporter asked if Westbrook and Durant exchanged high-fives, to which Russ said this before smoke-bombing out of the press conference: 
“Did you see it? Oh, OK. Y’all have a great time, I’ll see you in the second half of the season.” 
Earlier, another journalist wanted Westbrook to divulge more about a conversation the Thunder star had with Durant in the lead-up to the All-Star game, but he wasn’t taking the bait. 
“Yeh, I told him...I’m not telling you, but you know he did a good job, he got it done,” Westbrook said. 
The reporter tried to get him to expand on the topic: “You told him to shoot early and often?” 
“Ah no, that’s what you said,” Westbrook snapped back while laughing. 
At halftime, Durant was asked about the alley-oop. Like Westbrook, he didn’t say much, but did compliment his former teammate’s hops. 
“He’s a great basketball player. He was open, so I threw him the lob and he can jump really high so, yeah, good play,” Durant said. 
While it was fun to see these two connecting once again, it’s clear they’re not going to mend this broken relationship any time soon. Davis dominates All-Star game
